intro: Dammara celebica, commonly known as the Celebes dammara, is a tropical tree native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and long, narrow leaves. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid, warm climates. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
